document_data.name: Othea Tor
document_data.mainbody: '''Othea Tor''' was an isolated mountain far to the north of [[Faerûn]], the physical manifestation of [[Othea]] in her death.
document_data.Description:
The ice-covered mountain was only about 200 feet high. It looked like the figure of a plump woman kneeling on the ground and hunched over. The mountain had been named by the [[verbeeg]] [[Basil (verbeeg)|Basil]].

Othea's "womb caves" were located far beneath its surface.
document_data.Geography: Othea Tor was located in the utter north of [[Faerûn]], beyond the [[Ice Spires|Ice Spires North]] and just south of the [[Endless Ice Sea]].
document_data.History:
When [[Lanaxis]] betrayed and poisoned his mother Othea and his siblings, Othea Tor grew brittle.

After [[Voninheim]] was covered in ice, [[Hartkiller]] emerged from the caves beneath the tor, fully grown and ready to restore [[Ostoria]].

In [[1369 DR]],{{Giantcraft date}} Othea Tor was destroyed by [[Tavis Burdun]] using [[Annam All-Father|Annam's]] axe [[Sky Cleaver]], so that Othea's shadow could not conceal the [[Voninheim|Bleak Palace]] and [[Twilight Vale]] any longer, allowing he and his companions to confront Lanaxis.
